title: Lucca Ferraz
text:
Welcome to my website! I am a Junior at Rice University majoring in Statistics and Sport Analytics, with minors in Data Science and Financial Computation and Modeling.
I am a mathematically-oriented thinker interested in using data to solve complex problems in the real-world. My career interests lie in sport analytics, quantitative finance, and data science. Throughout my coursework, internships, and passion projects, I have developed skills in R, Python, and SQL.
In my free time, you can find me playing basketball, chess, and the tuba. Please have a look around my website, and feel free to contact me if you have any questions or want to connect!

title: Regularized Regression Project
text: Utilized regularized regression to evaluate top offenses and defenses in college basketball. Rasch model allows for applications in game prediction and team evaluation ahead of March Madness.

title: Intro to Sport Analytics Final Project
text: Utilized logistic regression to create an expected points model for the NBA 2023-24 regular season. Explored potential applications in team evaluation, predictive power, and player evaluation of scoring ability (both on-ball and off-ball), including building a Regularized Adjusted Plus-Minus metric.

title: 2024 SMT Data Challenge Submission
text: Project focused on optimizing batting order in minor league baseball using farm system data provided by SMT. Multifaceted approach to game simulation taking into account baserunner speed, pitcher fatigue, directional tendencies, and more.

title: CMSACamp Capstone Project
text:
Research Question: How can we best explain the variance of batted passes in the NFL on a play-by-play basis?
Utilized a multilevel model taking into account quarterback and defensive team as random effects, with information about the play (ex. formation, pass location) as fixed effects.

title: 2025 Big Data Bowl Submission
text: 2025 Big Data Bowl Submission focused on predicting whether tight ends would block or not pre-snap. Applied Gaussian Mixture Model to categorize pre-snap movement as well as Recurrent Neural Network for a frame-by-frame view of blocking probabilities.
